task.title: Download and unzip the PuTTY binaries

step.cmd: Open your Web Browser and navigate to the PuTTY homepage at http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/
step.info: You will be presented with the PuTTY home page (at the time of this writing).The link provided above is for a 3rd party website that hosts the PuTTY binaries. The link or availability of PuTTY at a later date may differer.

step.cmd: Click on the Download link and download the latest version of PuTTY:
step.info: You can also download a ZIP file containing all binaries and help files.

step.cmd: Unzip or place the downloaded files in a local directory.

step.info: The PuTTY website provides RSA keys compatible with both GnuPG and PGP2. This document provides instructions for installing GnuPG from the Gpg4win distribution on Windows, here: .

taskbody.result: You now have PuTTY on your machine.
